newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds slip on impatience with measures.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds slip on impatience with measures.

text.p: Argentine bonds slipped further Thursday on increasing impatience with political inaction over the budget deficit.
"The market wants action, not words," said a bond analyst at a large foreign bank in Buenos Aires.
The 5.5 percent dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 fell $0.25 to 114.25. Argentina's FRB due 2005 was unchanged at 76-5/8.
The market's growing concern is that the austerity measures including tax increases unveiled a couple of weeks ago will not be passed in full by Congress.
